definition: to grade/to mark (student's work)/grade/score (of student's work)
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: Aural tests are objective and can be graded mechanically.
sentences.chinese: 听力测验是客观的，可以机械地评分。

sentences.english: Our teacher is known for her fairness in grading pupils.
sentences.chinese: 我们的老师以给学生评分公平著称。

sentences.english: Deterioration in the SRS and ODI scores was of statistical significance.
sentences.chinese: SRS及ODI评分恶化有明显的统计学意义。

sentences.english: There were no score sheets, no nothing.
sentences.chinese: 目前还没有评分表，没有什么。

sentences.english: Also to investigate the relationship between Abnormal FHR with neonatal prognosis.
sentences.chinese: 还分析监护异常图形和阿氏评分的关系。

sentences.english: Your grade will be based entirely on homework assignments.
sentences.chinese: 你的期末成绩将依据作业成绩来评分。

sentences.english: How are assessments marked and managed?
sentences.chinese: 测评是如何评分与管理的？

sentences.english: MERIT】Each child will get a mark according to the merit of his work.
sentences.chinese: 每个孩子都会依其工作的表现而被评分。

sentences.english: Verification of wound in scoring scale.
sentences.chinese: 评分表评定伤情的验证。

sentences.english: Context The coronary artery calcium score (CACS) has been shown to predict future coronary heart disease (CHD) events.
sentences.chinese: 冠状动脉钙评分已经被用来预测未来冠心病事件。

sentences.english: In a series of tasks, teams will be awarded points based on their performance.
sentences.chinese: 比赛设一系列任务，各队将依据各自的表现获得评分。

sentences.english: Do you think the professor will grade on the curve?
sentences.chinese: 你认为教授会在评分中搞鬼吗？

sentences.english: With a credit score of 680 or higher, you have a plethora of home loan options.
sentences.chinese: 以信用评分680或更高，你有过多的贷款方案。

sentences.english: There is a little reduction of individual biases toward certain examinees after rater training.
sentences.chinese: 培训后评分员对个别考生的偏颇性没有明显减少。

sentences.english: Come from Google rated PR4 or higher pages where the link appears.
sentences.chinese: 从谷歌来评分个PR4以上的链接出现在页面。

sentences.english: The raters ranged in age from 18 to more than 70.
sentences.chinese: 评分者的年龄跨度从18岁至70岁以上。

definition: cotyledon of a bean (i.e. either of the halves of a bean seed that can be split apart after removing the seed coat)/thick bean sauce (abbr. for 豆瓣醬|豆瓣酱[dou4 ban4 jiang4])
public praise/public reputation/commonly held opinions/current idiom
passing line or score (in an examination)
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)
to pass an exam or a test/to meet a minimum standard
